38976665.review: Quake III Arena. One of the truly classic multiplayer FPSes, Q3A was probably the first FPS to dispense with the traditional single-player campaigns that were such a prominent feature of its predecessors. Offline play consists of fighting against bots across the classic Q3A stock maps, but it's online where the game really shines. While the old master servers are long since gone, Q3 multiplayer is still enjoyed by a great many - often via source ports such as ioquake3 - and still stands the test of time. This is a solid entry in id's canon of mighty FPS games and still highly enjoyable today.

36597152.review:
Quake III est le jeu de la radicalisation pour Id Software. D'une part il fait le choix de ne plus supporter le rendu sofware et exige donc une carte 3D pour tourner et d'autre part se limite exclusivement à du multijoueurs d'où le nom Arena. Si le premier aspect est largement compréhensible suite à la démocratisation des cartes 3D à l'époque de sa sortie, le choix du tout multijoueurs est plus osé. Un mode solo existe quand même mais il s'agit d'une succession de matchs en free-for-all contre des bots. C'est donc extrêmement simpliste mais cela permet déjà de goûter aux délices du gameplay.
Sorti fin 1999 et en concurrence frontale avec Unreal Tournament, Quake 3 est probablement resté dans les mémoires comme le plus grand des deux FPS compétitifs. John Carmack y peaufine une fois de plus la technique et surtout le gameplay. Précision et rapidité sont les maîtres-mots ici et le rythme du jeu est si élevé que Quake 3 ne donne plus la possibilité de jouer aux "réflexes" mais plutôt à l'"instinct". La vitesse, les déplacements, les effets des armes, tout est minutieusement travaillé pour donner au final des sensations parfaites. Difficile de lutter face à la satisfaction que procure le titre que ce soit lorsqu'on met la main sur un Quad Damage ou que l'on aligne un adversaire d'un tir impeccable de railgun. Un jeu exceptionnel.

36518036.review:
[h1] QUAKE III ARENA - лучший мультиплеерный шутер.	[/h1]

Здесь не нужно лишних слов. Если вы не играли в Quake III, то вы понятия не имеете, что такое "шутер". В детсте то еще веселье было, устраивать зарубы с ботами, которые фору дают и сегодня. Я не застал Quake как кибер-дисциплину, и не играл на "профессиональном" уровне, или, как минимум, с людьми по мультиплееру QIII. Но сама механика, и азарт и энергия игры сразу прочувстовалась мне даже в геймплее с ботами.

Конечно, мультиплеер здесь, если даже и жив(а скорее всего нет), то он явно переживает свои не лучшие времена, ибо старожилы Квейка уверенно себя чувствуют в Quake Live, да и Quake Champions. Но, порой, возвращаться на старую Арену все так же задорно и адреналиново, ибо по геймплею эту игру еще никто не переплюнул.

Просто купите эту игру в стиме. Хотя бы в дань серии. Пусть даже не за полную цену, но все же. Она заслуживает того.

[h1]Una obra maestra Un bot me llamó NERD xD[/h1]

[b]*Velocidad
*Reacción
*Coordinación

Esa es la combinación que necesitas para jugar a esto... [/b]

Este juego es sin duda uno de los pioneros en los torneos que usuamente se han vuelto populares en estos tiempos, sí amigo así es Quake inició ese mundo del deporte y competencia, pero dirás ¿Qué demonios tiene este juego de bueno?, y dejame decirte que es una excelente pregunta ya que el juego en sí ya tiene casi dos décadas de haber salido.

Lo que este juego te ofrece es una experiencia de multijugador verdaderamente retante, donde claro esta que la coordinación mano/ojo es fundamental, aquí no existen campers, solamente existen las reacciones que te salen solo de los reflejos de la acción frenética del mismo, nada de idiotas quejandóse ni nada de eso velocidad y más velocidad eso es todo.

El juego tiene una curva de aprendizaje que requiere tiempo, y generalmente hace que la mayoría de los jugadores de otros juegos lo dejen de inmediato.

¿Qué tiene de bueno?

[list]
    [*]Demasidados mapas incluidos en los que pasarás un buen rato.
    [*]Dificultad de los bots si no quieres probar el online mejor que la de cualquier juego actual.
    [*]Multijugador muy avanzado y flexible para su época.
    [*]Mods para instalar el modo profesional y sacarle más jugo al juego.
[/list]

¿Qué tiene de malo?

[list]
    [*]La velocidad del movimiento puede afectar a algunos usuarios visualmente (pretexto para no jugar por ser malo xD)
    [*]El sistema anti trampas que poseía cuando lo adquirias en disco NO SIRVE YA y no viene incluído aquí
    [*]Multijugador casi vacío y lleno de usuarios usando trampas
[/list]

Calificación 9/10

Si después de esto no quieres probar esta reliquia de juego, consigue Quake Champions que es prácticamente este pero con gráficos, físicas y DLC que lo llevan a la actualidad (En serio el sesarrollador del juego dice que este juego es prácticamnte Quake III Arena pero traido a la actualidad).

36070697.review:
[b]Intro[/b]
Quake III Arena is one hell of a game. I grew up on the Unreal side and so I'm a little biased towards that series, but I still love the Quake series and this game is still amazing in comparison to UT99 and all on its own. A crowning
achievement for arena FPS, multiplayer FPS and for iD.

[b]The Great:[/b]
++Totally skill-based deathmatch galore. Git gud, or git rekt. Balanced, competitive gameplay but easily accessible to casuals.
++Weapons deliver power and will destroy opponents when used right. Great arsenal and impactful feel.

[b]The Good:[/b]
+Movement is a joy and is key to success
+Gore is great
+The amount of characters from iD games over the years is awesome
+Sound design is decent
+Brilliant graphics with impressive texture work and animations
+Runs very well on modern systems without any tweaking necessary (unless you want HD resolutions and higher FOV, of course)
+Awesome music

[b]The Okay/Not Too Big of a Deal:[/b]
+-N/A

[b]The Bad:[/b]
-The AI is just aim-botty on the hardest difficulty
-Maps aren't too visually diverse, even if the artstyle is good
-Too light on gameplay customisation
-Short campaign

[b]The Horrible:[/b]
--An expensive add-on (Quake III: Team Arena) was released to add maps and game modes that absolutely should have been there from the beginning

Sound: 8/10
Graphics: 9/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Content/Replayability: 5/10 (without a community)
Overall: 8/10

[b]Conclusion[/b]
There's no reason to compare UT99 against this. Both are fantastic in similar ways and for different reasons. It's not anywhere near as much of a must-buy as it most certainly was when it had a community, but even against bots it's still
a lot of fun.

35245902.review:
Quake III Arena – многопользовательский шутер от первого лица. Таинственная раса Вадригар уже как несколько столетий отбирает лучших воинов, которых им удается найти, и отправляет на арену для гладиаторских боев. Никто не знает о могуществе этой расы, но им удалось то, что кажется невозможным, сделать свои “игрушки” практически бессмертными, от чего павший воин тут же возрождается и снова отправляется в бой на потеху своим похитителям. А что если вы тоже являетесь одним из представителей Вадригар? Тогда, чего же вы сидите? Выбирайте себе марионетку и докажите, что именно ваш воин заслуживает считаться лучшим из лучших!

Так что же такое, Quake III? Это многопользовательский шутер, который никак не связан с первыми двумя частями, в нем даже нет как таковой одиночной компании, а все что есть, это можно назвать боями против ботов. Сражаясь против компьютера, вы проходите так называемые тиры, или проще сказать уровни которые включают в себя до 4-х карт. Начиная с самого начала, вы встретитесь всего лишь с 1 противником, но по мере прохождения, их будет становиться все больше и они будут сложнее. И так, пока вы не встретитесь с одним из самых лучших гладиаторов.
В целом, игра построена на мультиплеерных баталиях, которые выглядят полным адом в хорошем смысле этого слова. Множество видов оружия, постоянные возрождения, обилие врагов – все это не даст вам заскучать в игре. Конечно, мне как человеку любящему вторую часть игры, а именно одиночную компанию, горько осознавать, что 3-я часть никак не продолжила сюжетную историю, да и вовсе, как я уже сказал, не имеет как такового одиночного режима. Но для многих, Квейк это в первую очередь сетевые баталии, и я не могу с ними не согласиться. Ведь это именно то, за что мы любим Кваку.

И если вас вдруг смутится англоязычный интерфейс, вы всегда можете посетить руководства к игре и найти информацию о том, как ее русифицировать.

Маус одобряет! =)

34825624.review:
This legendary FPS series has truly stood the test of time and is still a total blast to play years after its release. It’s a steal when on sale for 75% off but the collection is normally only $25 and totally worth the asking price in my opinion. I didn’t want to review all 3 games and their expansion pack material separately, so I figured I’d simply do a review for QUAKE III and do a brief breakdown for all titles.

QUAKE: It’s dark and creepy atmosphere takes a page from Lovecraftian lore and though its dated appearance and overly dark lighting (for some reason you can’t seem to adjust the brightness at all, or at least I couldn’t) may turn some off from playing this game, it still has a lot to offer whether you’re a fan simply looking for a little bit of nostalgia from a beloved shooter series or a gamer merely looking to partake of some classic gaming and you’ve heard the word ‘QUAKE’ thrown around for a number of years and figured it was about time you got around to checking it out. This game singlehandedly gave birth to speedrunning and rocket jumping in FPS games. Even if you don’t want to give it a spin, or its 2 mission expansion packs (both just as good as the core game and they still maintain the Lovecraftian element but with some Egyptian elements as well), at least check out all of the crazy ‘QUAKE done quick’/’QUAKE done quickest’ videos and I think you’ll agree that you can at least appreciate what QUAKE did for the FPS genre, if not the game itself.

QUAKE II: A change in both tone and style (no more Lovecraft, total sci-fi setting now), this game will likely be much more enjoyable to play than its predecessor for most people. It is graphically much more impressive and the particle effects are real!! Seriously, they look great and the lighting in the environments is much better than the doom/gloom of QUAKE. Even without the inclusion of Lovecraftian lore/enemies, there are still some disturbing biomechanical abominations to go along with the sci-fi setting, so that’s a good thing. Also, just like with QUAKE, there was sadly no music, at least for me, but the sound effects are good and it’s still fun to play. Oh yeah, you can now look around with your mouse. Sure, that’s nothing new per se but when coming from QUAKE and going directly into QUAKE II that’s going to feel new and revolutionary all over again. Both expansion packs are just as good as the core game and combined, they at least rival its length if not surpass it.

QUAKE III: Totally awesome! It’s basically just Unreal Tournament Quake style w/ a crazy mix of characters/boss characters (essentially just regular characters but tougher) running around at a super high framerate, each trying to out-kill the next guy. This game makes me wish I would have been into the whole multiplayer deathmatch thing back when it first came out, but it also makes me glad that we now have QUAKE: Champions and there is still supposedly a reboot coming our way that would pull mostly from QUAKE and its Lovecraftian themes. I haven’t tried QUAKE III: Team Arena yet but I figure it’s mostly the same thing albeit with team deathmatch added into the mix.

34703775.review:
Quake III was so good it got away with not having an actual single player. 

Untold centuries ago the Vadrigar, the mysterious Arena Masters, constructed the Arena Eternal for their own infernal amusement. Virtually nothing is known of these beings except that they savor the carnage and clamor of battle. As such, they have stocked the arena with the greatest warriors of all time - and you have just joined their ranks. 

At least, that's what the wiki told me. 

Quake III arena was the first game in the series to focus heavily on multiplayer. While the games that preceded it had fluff to their stories, Quake III just kind of tells you to get in an arena and shoot at everything that isn't you. 

Instead of having stages where you go toe to toe with goofy looking goons, you instead just play a multiplayer map against bots, each set of maps has harder and harder bots until you reach the final map where you go one on one against Xaero. 

It's not really fun, I mean, it is, but technically so is huffing gas. All of the fundamentals are there, but in the end you just have brain damage.

Okay, enough about that, lets fellate ourselves about the multiplayer. 

Quake III is one of those games that stands the test of time, even to this day you can find people filling out servers. The game modes cover everything you need, Deathmatch where you shoot everyone, team deathmatch where you shoot everyone not wearing the same color as you, tournament that nobody plays, and capture the flag where you shoot at everyone not wearing the same colors as you but also have to steal their colors and bring them back to your side.

I think I just described a gang war. 

The maps take the show, while not all of them are perfect (There's a CTF map that's just two platforms separated by jump pads) most of them are well designed and thought out. The name of the game is knowing the layout of the map, where the pick ups are, and where most of the fighting will be. 

This leads to a meta game that's all about map control. You need to know where the right weapons and items will spawn and get there before everyone else. And luckily you have plenty of movement options to do so. Bunny hopping, and rocket jumping being the obvious forms of transportation in this case. 

Every weapon, while not unique in use, is at the very least unique in design. The machine gun looks more like a drill than a gun, the rocket launcher is basically a redesign of the first two, and the plasma gun is a Tupperware box with a hose sticking out of it. I love them. 

You have a plethora of characters to choose from in Quake III, although they're all just for cosmetic. But it makes the game feel like a very violent version of Smash Bros. You have original characters such as Sarge, Major, Klesk, Visor, and Orbb. But you also get to choose from heroes from Id Games past like Doom Guy, Ranger, and Bitterman. 

And if none of those are to your fancy, you can always just find fan made models still lurking in the deepest darkest parts of the internet. Incase you ever wanted to play as Cloud with a rocket launcher. Fun story, the first time I ever saw a 40k Space Marine was in Quake III, I had no idea what it was from I thought it was a Quake 3 original character.

You should probably be warned though, if you're going in for the first time. Many people are playing Quake III, have been playing it for a long, long time. They basically know every single thing about the game inside and out. That being said, you can still find newcomers to the franchise playing to this day, although in smaller numbers.

And these guys are vicious. They move like speed demons if speed demons figured out what actual speed is. Their accuracy is friggin pin point, and they'll have that weapon before you even know what it is. One guy even managed to stop me from grabbing a rocket launcher by using the back blast of his weapon to knock me away from it. That's crazy. 

Oh yeah, I should probably cover the other ways you can play Quake III. Like I always do with these games. 

Outside of the obvious way to play, which is the PC version, you can also play this game on the PS2 with Quake Revolution as well as the port of Quake III on the Dreamcast. The Dreamcast port actually had online play and mouse/keyboard support. Apparently you can still find people playing the DC port to this day, but good luck with that because I don't know how. 

Also, there is a Xbox Live Arcade port of Quake III, but there's no reason to even talk about it. It's about as pointless as my Doctorate in Medicine. 

I'm not going to pretend my rating system actually matters for this review, Quake III's legacy speaks for itself. It's still being played to this day and finding a game is no problem. 

Arena's Engine, Id tech 3, also saw some action in a handful of other venerated shooters like Medal of Honor: Allied Assault, Star Trek: Voyager- Elite Force, Jedi Outcast and Jedi Academy, and even the original Call of Duty. I've even been told that the newer Call of Duty games just use a heavily modified version of the Quake III engine, though I don't know how true that is. 

You should play Quake III, but you probably already did. But in case you didn't, consider this another recommendation. 

Quake III test negative on it's STD test. Which means it fails, but in a good way.

Quake Revolution was published by EA. So that's weird.

와이드스크린 해상도로 퀘이크 하는법

1. 퀘이크3 깔린 폴더로 간다
2. baseq3 라는 폴더로 들어간다
3. q3config.cfg 로 들어간다
4. seta r_mode 라는 부분을 찾고 값을 "-1" 로 바꾼다
5. seta r_customwidth 라는 부분을 찾고 원하는 해상도의 가로 길이를 넣는다.
(1920X1080 으로 하고싶으면 1920을 넣는다.)
6. seta r_customheight 라는 부분을 찾고 원하는 해상도의 세로 길이를 넣는다.
(1920X1080 으로 하고싶으면 1080을 넣는다.)
7. 파일을 저장하고 퀘이크를 키면 원하는 해상도로 퀘이크를 할수 있다.

Ah, Quake 3. One of the many 90's games that DEFINED the first person shooter, before the genre went down the first person "Sh*tter". The game has graphics which were ahead of the time, at the time, gets the job done, doesn't care about stupid skilltrees, loadouts, classes, or any other level of bullsh*t, and goes in favour of pure, unfiltered, fast-paced shooting that's still fun today. And for those of you who are worried that the game would no longer have anyone playing online because of how old it is, hoo boy, are you ever wrong. Usually the multiplayer server count clocks around 400 servers. Jeez. This game is great, and I highly reccomend getting it if you're sick of today's generic shooters, in which you run slow as balls, have a tiny clip, horrible accuracy, and a VERY small margin of error.
Quake 3 FTW!

34366217.review:
It's not that the game was at the pinnacle of design in the day.  It isn't that it had the tried and true basic weapons from the first generation of first person shooters.  It isn't that it was the first real organic looking game, thanks to the curving in the level design (Quake 2 had better maps, even if they weren't as pretty).  It is because the game came out and competed with Unreal Tournament 1999.  You play either game, and you get tired of the Q3, very fast.  It's wonderfully paced, very fast...but that is it.  The weapons are old hat, the maps in vanilla are brown to red to black, and the single player botplay is very tiring...
Buy this if you want to be punished, and punished you will be online. But it isn't that great of a game.  It was a response to a new kid (UT) coming out, and it had to dominate the MP arenas.  Don't buy this if you have a good, modern PC.  Buy Lawbreakers, instead.  Or download UT4 for free.

34261103.review:
스타와 함께 중학교때의 인생의 반을 바친 게임이자, 과거 언리얼 시리즈와 함께 쌍벽을 이룬 하이퍼 FPS의 대표작이자, 오버워치 파라들의 천국인 퀘이크 시리즈. 그 중 멀티로서 가장 사랑을 받은 퀘이크 3이다.

이미 출시된지 20년정도 된 것 같은데, 퀘이크 시리즈는 매번 3D 그래픽의 수준을 매번 크게 상향 평준화시키는데 일조를 했고, 무엇보다 데스매치라는 학살의 쾌감을 정립해나가는데 가장 큰 역할을 한 게임이 아닌가 싶다. "아니 무슨 개똥망 그래픽 게임에 그딴 찬사를 보내나"할 수도 있는데, 당시 그래픽 수준을 생각하면 퀘이크 시리즈의 등장은 3D 그래픽 발전을 견인하였다고 볼 수 있을정도로 대단한 그래픽이었다.

게임스타일은 철저한 개인플레이에 철저한 실력위주이자 죽이는게 가장 주목적인 킬딸지상주의 플레이다. 상성이나 운이나 팀빨 등이 작용할 여지가 없는 순수한 진검승부이다. 그래서 인지 실력차가 나는 이상 절대로 역전 같은 기적은 일어나지 않고 100:0까지도 가능한 정말 무섭도록 실력위주의 게임이다.

점프패드 타고 겁없이 돌진하는 적을 로켓런쳐로 띄운뒤 착지하기 전에 공중에 날아가는 적을 저격총으로 맞추고 가까스로 착지한 적을 밑에서 기다렸다가 건틀렛(근접 무기)으로 지져서 마무리하는 것이 가능하다. 또는 로켓런쳐로 에어샷한다음, 튕겨저 날아가는 궤도를 예측해서 에어샷 콤보로 공중에서 죽여버릴 수도 있다. Quake 3 frag movie로 검색하면 말도 안 되는 묘기대행진을 볼 수 있다.

다만 퀘이크1,2에서 존재했던 잡몹과 보스들을 잡으면서 진행하는 캠페인 모드가 사라지고 오로지 멀티전용으로만 나온것으로서 많은 팬들로부터 아쉬움을 남겼었다.

오버워치하면 파라를 고를때매다 과거 퀘이크의 로켓런쳐가 생각난다. 퀘이크의 로켓런쳐 포지션과 티어에 비해 초라해진 모습. 메르시가 따라다니지 않는한 눈치봐가며 견제사격이나 하는 조연으로 몰락해버린것을 볼때마다 퀘이커로서 가슴이 아프다. 퀘이크 새로운 시리즈가 나올것 같은데 다시 하이퍼 FPS의 원조로서 호쾌한 데스매치 붐이 일었으면 한다.

33618267.review:
Quake III: Arena is undeniably a classic game, and one of the best FPS out there. It was widely utilized as an e-sports game, and is still used in smaller tournaments. Despite showing age graphically, its gameplay still holds up quite well.  Despite being over 15 years old, there are still plenty of servers and fans still playing to this day. To make this easy for me, I'm going to do a quick pros-cons list.

Pros:
-servers still relatively active, not too hard to find other players
-dozens of different player models to choose from
-player models don't need to be unlocked
-high skill ceiling, very competitive
-simple gameplay with surprising death
-almost a time capsule of old-school FPS design
-classic Arena-style game mechanics/gameplay
-controls crisp and responsive
-huge amount of maps, nearly all of which are pretty darn good
-cool announcer voice
-badass, well-animated intro cinematic
-exciting, fast-paced multiplayer action
-solid singleplayer AI (as in they don't spaz out)

Cons:
-dated visuals
-occasionally very frustrating
-can seem inaccessable
-quite unlike most contemporary multiplayer FPS, not for COD fans (basically the opposite of COD)
-no true single-player campaign 
-no plot, only really a premise
-can't run modern resolutions/widescreen without tampering
-framerate cap at 90 (for those who actually care)
-spawns sometimes 'questionable'

Quick rundown on basic gameplay:
-only gamemode in the base game is FFA Deathmatch
-everyone starts equal, with the same two weapons (melee and machinegun)
-other, better weapons spawn around the map
-no regenerating health, need items to replenish health and armor
-items spawn around the map on a timer
-items include weapon ammunition, power ups, and health and armor
-the only objective is to kill (frag) other players
-very frantic and fast-paced; to stand still is suicide (gotta go fast)

There are probably a few things I've missed pros and cons-wise, but they share most of my opinions on the game. While I do reccomend this game, I do understand that it is not for everyone, although there's no hurt in trying :)

29453119.review:
I have been playing this game since it first came out when I was just a young lad. I probably have thousands of hours in it and I also used to mod the hell out of it, creating custom player models, skins, weapons, levels, textures, shaders, etc... 

You won't find a more fast-paced and visceral arena shooter anywhere. The gameplay still stands up to other titles today, in my opinion. The graphics are pretty dated, but if you can get past that just enjoy the haunting atmoshpere of the levels and the relentless, gory action - you are in for one hell of a ride. 

This is still a go-to for my friends and I when we get together for a LAN. Running through the blood-mist of your friend after you obliterate them with a well-placed rocket never gets old :P 

I have put countless hours into this title and regret none of them lol. Solid game. Would definitely recommend. I cannot wait for the reimagining of this game in the upcoming Quake Champions :)

10/10.

Одна из первых игр с момента появления компа в 2001’м году. Ух, рубали в неё тогда будь здоров! Тогда ещё школьником, помясить ботов с утра перед уроками было нормальным делом, а финальный босс тогда чуть ли не до истерики доводил.
Время шло, и порой возвращался к этой стрелялке. В более современную эпоху института играли по сетке, по инету с жутким пингом, вот тогда я и понял, что такое киберспорт и что мне в нём делать нечего. Валили можно сказать сразу, не успевал даже до более мощной волыны добежать, так все прыгали, носились, что голова кругом шла. Ностальгия была лишь в уничтожении ботов на более трудной сложности и не более.
Игрушка была забыта на долго, пока не приобрёл в стиме по скидке. Был удивлён, как с лёгкостью прошёл все арены буквально за вечер, а финальный босс превращался в мясной суп с лёгкостью, не помню даже, что вызывало в своё время такие сложности.
Данный текст не обзор скорее, а минутка ностальгии.
10 фрагов из 10’ти.

25679997.review: When I played Quake for the first time I can't really say that I fell in love with it at first sight. I guess it's because I was expecting something more "realistic" like Wolfenstein (yeah, I know, at least for the most part of it). Either way, that was because so far I never had the experience of playing anything online. Back in the day I had this friend who eventually convinced me to give it a try. After I started, it didn't take long for me to get hooked on it. Time passed by and someday Quake II was released. Then again, when I tried for the first time I felt kinda disappointed with the game and can't deny that I still feel somehow like that after all those years (I guess it's because I missed that "medieval environment" touch from the first one). Anyway, when I first heard of Quake III, I didn't quite know what I should expect. I just read about the premise that the game was developed to be focused on the multiplayer experience. The irony was that although this title had exactly that concept in mind, that was the only one that I never had the chance to play with other people. Hmm what is there to say? For me it felt like a polished version of Quake II's multiplayer and later it wasn't hard to compare it with Unreal Tournament (which I won't deny that I liked better). Besides that, back then there were some really interesting mods involving the game's engine, like for example "Bid for Power", which had some DBZ characters and levels to play on. Overall, it's not a bad game, you can even play it casually if you're not in the mood to go through a whole set of matches.

25200736.review:
Quake III - классика сетевых шутеров и просто отличная игра прямиком из начала 2000-х годов. Для неё есть тьма модов и карт (см. Moddb и тематические сайты). Если вы никогда не играли в подобные игры, то советую начать именно с этой.
В игре нет сюжета и сингла. Там вы дерётесь на закрытых (и не очень) "аренах" с такими же, как вы, соперниками. "Погибшие" становятся "фрагами" и отправляются на респаун. Полное равенство возможностей. Никакого доната. Никаких лиг, рейтингов и прочего мусора из современных онлайн-шутеров. Есть только вы сами, соперники, оружие и арена. Ну ещё и флаги, "руны", в зависимости от режима игры.
Освоиться очень просто. Минут через 15 вы наверняка будете бодро месить ботов. Если выбрали правильную сложность для знакомства с игрой.
Кстати, о ботах. Их 32 (плюс ещё десяток с чем-то из аддона Team Arena). И они выглядят оригинально. Но при этом они на сложностях Hurt me plenty и Hardcore влупить не по-детски.
Но когда вы более-менее хорошо натренируетесь, то придёт пора для сложности Nightmare.
И это, скажу я вам, натуральный трэш и уберхардкор, без скидок и послаблений.
Боты на Nightmare превращаются в "терминаторов", не промахивающихся почти никогда, разве что вы успеете увернуться.
Замерли секунды на две-три на месте - вы фраг.
Не успели увернуться, сделали неверное движение - вы фраг.
Не прострелили проход или не пальнули назад на всякий случай - вы фраг.
Не научились прилично двигаться (распрыжка, стрейф) - вы фраг.
Промахнулись при выстреле - вы фраг.
Попались на глаза обладателю рейлгана - вы фраг.
У ботов абсолютный слух и абсолютное зрение. Но пользуются ими на всю катушку они именно на Nightmare. Но при этом у них есть чудовищный недостаток - напрочь отсутствует ИИ, они не способны на командное взаимодействие. Так что всё, на что они способны - это меткая стрельба.
Не советую своаться в онлайн до тех пор, пока вы не научитесь соперничать с ботами на Nightmare. В онлайне всё то же самое, и даже жёстче.
Плюсы:
- легко освоить азы;
- много режимов игры;
- неповторимая динамика и драйв;
- ощущение реального адского рубилова (особенно в онлайне и на высоких сложностях);
- можно скачать из сети много пользовательских карт и модификаций;
- можно создавать свои карты (об этом есть куча туториалов, но в основном на английском);
- есть много вспомогательных программ и утилит (интерфейс, правда, английский).
Минусы:
- нет русской локализации (но интерфейс прост как табуретка);
- тупые боты (могут только стрелять метко и бегать по заданным маршрутам).
Вердикт: попробовать однозначно стоит. Даже за полную цену. В этой игре за 400 с хвостиком рублей есть много такого, чего нет в современных аналогах за большую стоимость.

This is one of the franchises that I hold closest to my heart.
Although it is my considered opinion that Quake 3 played second fiddle to the first Unreal Tournament, I can't deny this game. Why? Because you will not find a second fiddle anywhere near this damn good game. Hell, you won't find many first fiddles either. Honest to God: I love this game.
I honestly think the era of arena shooters was too short for its own good. Although I have high hopes for the new Unreal Tournament, it might not bring the arena shooter back to the mainstream stage as many have hoped. I hope it does, but I understand it has a lot to live up to.
This game has spectactular gunplay that is expected of the Quake series, that fast paced, adrenaline rushing gameplay that made arena shooters fun.The map DM17, otherwise known as The Longest Yard has become one of the most iconic FPS maps, ranking alongside Unreal Tournament's Facing Worlds. There's just no words to describe that feeling of launching off of a boost pad and sniping your enemy in midair with the Railgun. 
The music fits the game extremely nicely, as do the environments. The computer opponents give you some pretty amusing dialouge during the single player campaign. 
So what are you waiting for?
Get out there and make your enemies Quake in fear!
Doom got a remake, Unreal Tournament is in the works, so all we need are Half Life 3 and Quake 5 and the 90's can be here once again!
A good old dose of pure 90's fun.

24771383.review:
If you weren't around for the release of Quake III, you might be shocked at the furor its announcement kicked up. In the wake of heavily story-driven FPSes like Half-life, Unreal, and even Quake II, the successor of one of the biggest franchises moving to multiplayer-only was seismic. Despite the doom-saying and gnashing of teeth among series fans, Quake III proved to be an instant classic for online FPSes and helped establish the multiplayer-only genre as legitimate. But how does an online-focused classic fare nearly 20 years after the fact?

I want to make fun of Quake III's story, but it's honestly about as much of one as Quake I has. Some bunch of space assholes called the Vadrigar have been grabbing badasses from across the universe to mash together in their own little lethal playhouse. This means you can play as the venerable Doom Guy, grunting wonder Ranger from Quake I, luckiest space marine ever Bitterman from Quake II, and a bunch of cooler dudes like a neon skeleton and an eyeball on legs. There's upwards of 30 characters to choose from, but honestly after Party Skeleton they seem kinda superfluous.

They're put to good use though in the game's campaign mode. See, there actually IS a single-player mode in Quake III, but it pits you against bots across seven tiers of simulated deathmatches. Starting you out one-on-one against slow-moving opponents in small arenas, the game soon expands to fragfests with half a dozen foes across industrial complexes and eldritch hallways floating in the void. As predictable as they can become, the bots provide a solid challenge at each of their five difficulties so it's actually not a bad place for newcomers to learn the art or veterans to practice their technique.

The weapons are simple enough to come to grips with as well. I don't know why the Quake series is so content to have incredibly generic arsenals, but it makes it easy to keep track of here. You start with a standard low-damage machine gun and can locate shotguns, rocket launchers, railguns, and plasma guns around the map, each with its own color-coded ammunition. There are health and armor pickups as well, along with a few stand-by powerups like quad damage. This pickup system, common in the Quake era, makes matches more about map control than anything else and can be a welcome change from modern loadouts and class systems.

This isn't going to matter a whole lot if you can't find actual humans to play with, of course. All the games of the Quake series still have fanatics playing them but they are just that, fanatics, which means they are limited in number and absurd in skill. It's not reasonable to expect newbie-friendly servers or anything other than pros to spar with so be prepared for that if you are diving into the scene solo. On the other hand, there are few things more sublime than some classic deathmatch with your closest buddies so if you have others you can take the plunge with this is an easy sell.

Barring any graphical weirdness (which for me was remedied with disabling the Steam overlay) Quake III remains a very clean and polished experience, from the sharp if simple graphics to the tinny, growling announcer. Your weapons feel thick and threatening, the gibs gush freely, and the low electric growl of quad damage taking hold never gets old. Without a story-based singleplayer to work through this one does threaten to wear out its welcome. However, a little courage and effort diving into the online community that persists will reveal a world of wonders you might have thought died long ago.



Did you enjoy this review? I certainly hope so, and I certainly hope you'll check out more of them at https://goldplatedgames.com/ or on my [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/audish#curation]curation page[/url]!

22799842.review:
Jak zapewne słyszeliście, Quake 3 Arena jest grą przeznaczoną do grania tylko w trybie multiplayer (wprowadzeniam do niego jest mały Prolog w Single ale o tym później). 
Dostęny rozpierdziel na multi jest w trybach:
- Deathmath
- Team Deathmath
- Tournament (pojedynki 1 vs. 1 przegrany odpada, zwycięzca gra z następnym, który czeka w kolejce)
- Capture the Flag

Pierwszą innowacją, która jest jedną z ciekawszych, są odznaczenia, które będziemy dostawać za nasze wyczyny na Arenie: 
PERFECT - za przejście mapki na jednym życiu, 
GAUNTLET - to dostaje się za zapiłowanie przeciwnika na śmierć, 
IMPRESSIVE - za dwa trafione strzały z RailGuna pod rząd, 
ACCURACY - 50% trafionych strzałów (a nie jest to takie proste jak by się mogło wydawać), 
EXCELLENT - dwa i więcej fragów z rzędu 
FRAGS - TA nazwa mówi sama za siebie... 

Kolejną przeepicką rzeczą (osobą) jest lektor, który "szatańskim" głosem będzie ci przypominał twoją pozycję podczas gry, jak również o odznaczeniu które przed chwilą dostałeś, co podnosi jeszcze bardziej poziom andrenaliny podczas gry.

Oręż jakim przyjdzie nam defragmentować przeciwników:
GAUNTLET – coś na kształt piły tarczowej, w głównej mierze służy do cięcia [strike]chleba[/strike] przeciwników.
MACHINEGUN – karabin maszynowy wyglądający jak młot pneumatyczny. Dostajemy Go na starcie, ma mało amunicji i jest niecelny.
SHOTGUN – noobowie nie lubią shotguna, ponieważ wolno szczela. We wprawnych rękach bierze zdrowego przeciwnika na strzała.
GRENADE LAUNCHER – zdecydowanie najgorsza broń w grze ze względu na zasięg. Z niewiadomych przyczyn wygląda jak pistolet maszynowy z Half-Life'a 1. 99% ludzi nie umie z niej strzelać...
ROCKET LAUNCHER – bazooka.
LIGHTING GUN – spawarka. smarka w praeciwnika czymś co miało przypominać piorun wydając przy tym odbłos burzy...
RAILUN – Karabin prawie snajperski, który zamienia przeciwnika w mielonkę za maksymalnie drugim trafieniem.
PLASMAGUN – strzela kulami plazmy z prędkością machineguna przy identycznym zapasie amunicji. Podczas dłuższego strzelania można dostać ataku epilepsji, ale niektórzy są skłonni zapłacić taką cenę za choć jednego fraga.
BFG 10K – zbanowana na większości serwerów, starszy brat BFG z Dooma. Krążą pogłoski, że strzał z BFG to jedyna rzecz, której Chuck Norris nie może odbić kopnięciem z półobrotu, ale nikt nie chciał tego przetestować z obawy przed wyzwoleniem się ogromnej ilości energii przy takim kontakcie, która mogłaby nawet zniszczyć WSZECHŚWIAT....

No ale nie tylko samym multi człowiek żyje...
Dawno dawno temu, w niedalekiej przyszłości, banda jakiś starych dziadów (Mistrzów Areny), którym na starość zaczęło odpeprzać, postanowiła rozpocząć mistrzostwa międzygalaktyczne najlepszych gladiatorów, jakich dało się znaleźć w kosmosie (stwierdzenie to traci swoją ważność kiedy poziom trudności w grze ustawimy poniżej NIGHTMARE!). Jak można się domyślić i my dołączamy do stawki...
Rozgrywka ta podzielona jest na siedem TIER'ów o różnym poziomie trudności – dostęp do kolejnego TIER'u otrzymujemy po przejściu wszystkich aktualnie dostępnych map na jakimkolwiek (na szczęście) poziomie trudności. 
A o to i owe poziomy:
I CAN WIN [1] przeznaczony jest dla początkujących – komputer nie unika strzałów, a sam nie potrafi za wiele (przynajmniej na pierwszych tierach). 
BRING IT ON [2] może zagrać każdy, kto próbował swoich sił w innych produkcjach FPP – boty zaczynają w Nast trafiać.
HURT ME PLENTY [3] to już zabawa dla bardziej zaawansowanych.
HARDCORE [4] to nie przelewki, nie ma tu miejsca na podziwianie krajobrazu (o ile można to co nas otacza nazwać w ten sposób..) jest tylko dobra walka dla prawdziwych wyjadaczy.
NIGHTMARE! [5] chodzą słychy, że tylko Chuck Norris przeszedł Q3 na tym trybie...

Podsumowując:
Plusy:
+ Nieśmiertelne multi,
+ Świetnie zoptymalizowane poziomy trudności (każdy znajdzie coś dla Siebie),
+ Świetna oprawa Audio wraz z Epickiem głosem lektora :3
+ Pomimo upływu lat wciąż świetnie się prezentuje.
+ "Kampania" single,
+ Świetny Ragdoll oraz system fragmentacji przeciwników :D

Minusy:
- Brak wspierania rozdzielczości natywnych 16:9

Osobiście jestem wielkim fanem Q3, jest to gra mojego dzieciństwa, więc poniekąd moja ocena może dla niektórych być nie adekwatna do tego co jest w rzeczywistości. Jak dla mnie Quake III ARENA RULZ!

11/10 POLECAM!

19830875.review:
This was a game I found lying around my computer desk as a kid. After my first experience playing Quake II, which you can check that review for the experience, I had no idea what to expect from Quake III except greatness. It could have been a new single player, an enhanced multiplayer, really anything. But the word Arena was the next word I saw on the disk. I was a pretty smart kid, so I knew it was going to have a badass multiplayer. Little did I know that it was going to be ALL multiplayer.

So I booted up the game after installing it and started watching the intro. It showed some guy shooting down things and running out of ammo. The guy runs away and then decides to rush in. Immediately, I was a little unimpressed. After the Quake II intro, I was expecting awesomeness! Now it was just showing a cliche FPS sequence. Then, after diving towards the enemies, something unexpected happens. Time freezes as the guy is being teleported to some unknown place. This is where id Software did NOT disappoint! After being teleported, it then shows some gameplay of what I was going to be playing with random letters zooming out. I watched the gameplay and knew it had to be awesome. Then, the legendary words filled the CRT monitor.

[b]QUAKE III ARENA[/b]

I was hyped. I could not wait. So I went to the options to peek around and noticed there was a better Player Setup screen than Quake II. You could actually see who you were choosing before you picked them. MUCH better than having to scroll through the different models in Quake II to pick your character. And yes. Before you ask, the same customization of Quake II with being able to play as many different characters is avaliable here too. After picking this weird alien thing named Flisk, I immediately went into the game.

The graphics looked really nice. I was gazing upon the room I was in and noticed all the little details in the room. My eyes were like a kid in a candy store. The textures popped out like flowers in a field. The graphical detail was legend, and everything just seemed amazing. Then I noticed the mirror in the room. I gazed at my reflection and loved the little details on my character.

Another thing I noticed was the sudden announcer coming through my speakers. "WELCOME TO QUAKE III ARENA!!" I had never heard such a thing in a video game before. It was really mindblowing at the time. I then decided to test fire the guns I had collected. The machinegun sounded like a more powerful version of the one from Quake II, and the Shotgun sounded like it was the most devastating thing in the game. I decided to go outside the room and see what was going on around the map.

I immediately ran into Crash, the first enemy opponent in the game. She's like Doomguy except she's a girl. I shot her down with my shotgun and noticed that she talked to me in text like she was a friend in real life. Wow! Talk about advanced! I never had a character talk to me in text like that. It was something really special at the time and it's something games just don't do anymore. It's kinda sad, but I can see why.

Alright so the gameplay. Well, it's a shooter that is a heavily polished version of Quake II's multiplayer. Even the single player is just a bunch of fights with bots. Nothing really special, but it's good practice. The weapon balancing is something id wanted to do in this game and it really works well. Each weapon has its own use, just like the single player in Quake and Quake II. The Rocket Launcher is good for if your enemy is mid range, while guns like the Lightning Gun and Machinegun are great for long range attacks. The Shotgun is definitely used best at shorter ranges because of the more realistic spread this time around.

The gunplay isn't the only thing you'll want to learn in Quake III. Movement is definitely a really important skill to learn, especially if you plan on playing online. Since the original Quake engine had some bugs that made advanced moving techniques that are real useful in multiplayer possible, they decided to embrace those bugs and make them part of the physics of the game. Things like Bunnyhopping, circle jumping, and the infamous Rocket Jump are just a few examples of techniques that made Quake III very famous.

Overall, I gotta say that Quake III Arena is to FPS games as Super Smash Bros. Melee is to fighting games. The really complex formulas and techniques that were present in the original Quake are improved and embraced in every way imaginable and the multiplayer community is still really strong. There was even a Dreamcast port of Quake III designed with Keyboard & Mouse controls in mind due to these special techniques that also has cross-platform capabilities with the PC version! Definitely get this game and enter the Arena!

19302900.review:
/!\ Before you start this game ***DISABLE STEAM OVERLAY*** to get it working. /!\

This game absolutely rocked the FPS world back in the day. As a young pre-teen, I played my sports outside, did my homework and when I could, I'd jump on the PC to play this. If you have played Unreal tournament, it may ring a few familiar bells while playing this. If you can tolerate old graphics, you'll able to enjoy the gameplay.

What is Quake 3 : Arena? It is a first person shooter (FPS) multi-player focused game with fast pace featuring players duking it out for in front of a race called the Vadrigar. All the player movements are normal (four directional + strafing) with the addition of jumping. Mouse button 3 will allow the player to zoom and C will let the player crouch. Throughout the map there are items available for pick-up in which the player can press enter to use them. The basic strategy back in the day was jumping up and down and strafing while shooting. Playing the game today after so many years seems players have really figured out this technique and it's almost near impossible for me to hit them. Most servers are decently friendly (for n00bs as well) but some servers have some very good players. Most FPS's will demand a lot of attention from the player but this FPS will keep you moving due to paranoia. Non-stop movement is recommended.

The AI within the game is actually a formidable opponent. Upon first playing the game, I had some serious trouble beating the first level. I got back on the horse eventually and was able to ride to the next tier. One player mode will have you square off against stronger and stronger opponents the more you progress. The weapons in the game are outlandish in design and style while having their strong and weak points. Some weapons will benefit the player from a long range while some will demand a shorter range. The BFG10K is a plasma based weapon that can fire rapidly. The gauntlet is a short ranged melee type weapon in which the announcer will announce "humiliation" if an opposing player is killed. The gauntlet does not require ammo. The lightning gun fires a beam of "lightning" and is useful for groups of opponents. The railgun fires a hot slug rounds at a high velocity. It would be better to use this gun from a distance. The plasma gun obviously fires burst of plasma but is slow regarding it's firing rate. There is also a rocket launcher (that is pretty self explanatory and is my favorite weapon as it can make players bounce or explode). The last two include a machine gun and a grenade launcher. All the guns are fun to use but players will find their own style which work for them.

There are items scattered throughout the level and respawn after a short amount of time. The first item includes a red armor icon which has the most defense out of all armors. The yellow armor is half as good as the red and armor shards (pieces) will increase your armor by increments of +5. Besides armor, there is health around the map available for pickup. The blue health orb will replenish your health to a maximum while an orange health orb will only do half of what the blue can do. The small gold and green health orbs are the smallest units of replenishment. Also included are power ups. Power ups include a blue icon which quadruples the damage you deal, a red regeneration icon in which when you receive damage your heath will regenerate, a yellow icon which doubles your speed you fire your weapons, a purple icon which allows you to jump at unbelievable heights, invisibility (which is self explanatory) and a battle suit that can protect you from literally anything from the environment (lava, water + splash damage from opponents). Additional items include a personal teleporter (which will transport you into a random spot when in trouble), a medkit which can be activated by the user, in-place teleporters which have a pre-determined destination, jump pads which will launch the player and acceleration pads that will launch the player in the direction they are facing. Don't face the wrong side or an edge when approaching such a pad!

As I've said, this game is big time multi-player focused even though it has some single player events. There are differing game-modes to keep the player engaged : Free for all (where everyone plays for themselves), team deathmatch where two teams compete for the highest "frag" (kill) score, tournament mode which is one versus one ending after a set time and lastly, capture the flag. Capture the flag is played on maps in which both opposing sides have the same map layout (to keep everything fair).

This is a good game for hardcore FPS fan's while the casual gamer may find the graphics and gameplay lacking due to the difficulty. I would consider this one of those games where you really have to take the time to perfect your skill to get the most joy out of it. Back in the day, this game would have got a solid (8/10) rating and still can hold it's own with gameplay. Now that's it's aged :


RATING : 6.95/10

18263221.review:
[h1]An Awesome and Highly Addictive Arena FPS That will Test & Develop Your FPS Skills![/h1]

Quake III Arena is an awesome fast-paced arena-styled multiplayer FPS game. A pure deathmatch game at it's best. The controls are perfect, the vanilla graphics are still good today, and the gameplay... fucking awesome! One of my favorite features is the ability to play against bots with friends. Very fun if you just want to co-op in the game.

I will say one thing. This game will test your skills and even help you improve your aim and reaction time as the combat is fast and fierce. After playing this game, I can say I am better at FPS games, especially ones with rocket launchers ;). This is one thing I cannot say you will get from most FPS games. This gives it another reason why this game kicks so much a$$! Not only are you having fun, but you are excersising your hand-to-eye coordination.

[h1]Easy To Mod[/h1]

This game is also very easy to mod. All you need to do is open the .pk3 files in a program like WinZip or WinRar and you can replace the game's sound effects, graphics, and models with custom ones you either downloaded or made yourself.

Talking about mods, I highly recommend downloading ioQuake3 ( http://ioquake3.org ). It replaces Quake 3's rendering engine to suit modern machines giving you better net code and the ability to match your computer's native resolution. You can also download other mods for ioQuake3 to improve the game. Some other mods I recommend is the high res texture pack ( http://ioquake3.org/extras/replacement_content ) and the Metal-Tech v2.0 mod that replaces the textures for the weapons with higher res ones ( http://www.moddb.com/mods/metal-tech-v20-revolutions ).

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

On final note, this game is pure awesomeness and has a high replay value. If you are interested in playing a fast-paced FPS game to test out or improve upon your twitch skills, this is the game for you!

17455788.review:
Quake 3 Arena isn't really an expected sequel of Quake franchise. It actually throws off single-player portion fully and focuses on mutliplayer part, which was quite wise as of that time. Arena-styled Deathmatch was still hot and at the peak of interest, you see. It came out in 1999. It's notable that in same year Unreal pulled off same trick, coming out with Unreal Tournament.
It also had ports to Dreamcast and PS2. Dreamcast is awesome, supporting keyboard+mouse, 4-player split-screen, had online multiplayer and had new awesome music that PC doesn't have. PS2 version didn't had online part, but had improved single-player, with some story, from what I know. Didn't check out that one yet, but it has different final boss.

As you expect, it has usual technical problems nowdays.
Game doesn't support widescreen by default. But you can look up Community Guide on Steam, one explains how to set it up easily.
Steam Overlay is conflicting with this game as well. If you try to immeditly play at default setup, you will be horrified by all the graphical flickers and glitches. You have to go to game's system options and disable "GL Extension", after that it should be fine.
Though, some computers will still experience crashes here and there. In this case you will have to disable whole Steam Community for this game. Bai bai overlay.
I think that auto save from Team Arena expansion may erase Quake 3 Arena save. Goes both ways. So be careful with that one.

As for multiplayer community, it's somewhat alive. There are some servers with some players. Most often you will meet servers full of bots. Other times it will be pro players who will rip you apart.

So, what can I say. Q3 is a classic arena, where you spawn, you stock up, you encounter, you restock. Or respawn. While strafejumping and bunnyhopping like a chicken. Everybody starts the same, they spawn in random spot with no good weapons. After that you have to grab all the goodies on the map. Weapons, ammo, health, armor and powerups. Stocking and restocking is quite important, having more armor and health than opponent will put you into superior position. If you are good at shooting and maneuvering, that is. Health and armor over 100 slowly drop down, so you want to make use of it. You also want to be the first to grab the respawning powerup, which is announced by subtle sound. Pro players time it in mind. Remaining powerups drop from defeated players. 
And when it comes to duel, you should make sure that opponent will not get to timed powerups and big bonuses. It's called "Arena Control". It'a also wise to sometimes not to encounter the opponent.

It also has some physics exploits like bunnyhopping and harder to pull off strafejumping. Thankfully, bots don't use them.

Weapons are designed to be balanced with each other and to be useful in each own situation. It's mostly a tried and classic combination weapon set, of rocket launchers, shotgungs, railguns and such, so people who wanted a gun that ricochets around walls and turns enemies into ice cream critized them heavily. They work really nicely though. Railgun requires at least two hits on a row for average opponent, which is always better than usual instakill of sniper rifles in other games. Shotgun is good even for medium distance and just gives off a nice hitscan punch. Rocket Launcher is universal, good for splash damage with huge direct hit damage. Good for rocketjumps too. Really, it's great to see that the game took more balanced weapon approach of Quake 2 and tried to combine it with faster pace of Quake 1.

Level design is great too, with nice astethic. It's either sci-fi base or more of gothic-hellish red style. Like Quake 1 style, but more careful and even more evil at times, it's great. Has enough verticality. Just nicely done, with all the curves and corners. It also has some interesting "platforms in black space" levels, though those are the worse bunch as far as balance goes. Too much open space, railfun users be happy. Gets even worse on the level which has many lift-platforms, making it all look quite messy. Otherwise, nice layouts with nice looks.
Soundtrack is also nice too, being ambient-like at times and more actiony techno at others. Somewhat unique.

It has Free-For-All Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Duel and Capture the Flag modes. And bots are pretty bad at Capture the Flag for some reason. Expect to see them running with machine gun, failing to defend and failing to retrive the flag.

Now, as far single-player, well, it's pretty much a bunch of bot matches with some progression. The in manual says that mysterious race Vadrigar teleported the greatest warrior of all time into arenas for their own amusement and they can't be fooled by Death, combatants just respawn. in the end you will beat current champion Xaero, who's spirits will leave the body and it will turn into statue. And errrr, I guess you will be still stuck in Arena. Yep, story is quite an excuse. You will not see any kind of story in game itself, just means that it has many different skins with no bio. Like Id All-Stars, including Doom, Grunt and Ranger. But hey, some skins are cool, check out huge eyeball on two hands.

You should play on Hardcore if you are a good player. Normal and lower ones handicap bots actually.

And yea, it's just a bunch of Deathmatch matches with boss-like duel match for each Tier. In Deathmatch you will be hunting the weakest and spamming, in Duel you better be controlling spawn of bot's favourite weapon if you want to survive. Final boss really requires it, being Railgun auto-bot pro. This "campaign" will fly past quickly. Oh well, at least it has some feeling of progression, better than just leaving player with skirmish only.
Did I tell you that bots actually have a bit of behavior personality and favourite weapons?

And if you want to go online, then as said, it doesn't have as many players. More of bots. And it has really bad server browser that no one ever liked. Can't even categorize by amount of players.

To be honest, with Quake Live around, there is almost no reason to get Quake 3 for online, most of players went to Live. Quake 3 does have gibs, blood and it has Campaign of sorts, so maybe it's better for offliners who don't want to be beaten by pros.
And yea, this is old game with classic DM rules. Most modern gamers will not dig it for long. No leveling or such, more duel-based than team-based. But at least it was nice at the time, even if didn't try to be as original as UT, instead giving players more of classic set.

El mejor FPS que he jugado. Solía jugarlo cuando era muy pequeño, y de hecho, hoy en día sigo jugandolo con mi padre, y aún me recuerda los mejores momentos de mi infancia gamer junto a él, que me lo mostro en primer lugar.

Es un juego 'rápido' el cual requiere de habilidad y práctica constante para dominar.
No apto para gallinas gustadoras de Shooters modernos, campers, y ventajosos.
Aquí si no tienes [i]Real [/i] habilidad, eres hombre muerto.

Es un juego perfectamente calculado, increíble para la época. 
Requieres saber calcular los tiempos, las velocidades de las balas, y sobre todo anticiparte al enemigo.
Esto último es la clave para ser un gran jugador de Quake III Arena.

Fuera de la nostalgia y fanatismo, el juego posée excelentes factores admirables:
Música increíble.
Ambientaciónes adecuadas para el tipo de juego violento que es.
Mapas variados y excelentemente diseñados.
Muchos personajes para elegir y muy originales.
Varias armas mejoradas de sus antecesores Quake y Quake II.
Modos de juego como CTF, FFA, TDM y Tournament.
Facilmente moddeable.

Mi mapa favorito es (obviamente): '[i]Q3TOURNEY6[/i]'. El de Xaero, el clasico.
Vale absolutamente la pena pagar el precio por el juego.
Si aún no te has decidido por comprarlo, y eres un verdadero y honorable fan de los FPS, cómpralo.

There's absolutely no way to go wrong with this title. At a normal 20 dollars, you're probably not thinking too much of it, but, if you're reaing this the same day I put this up, it's THE best time to pick it up, as well as the Team Areana, which is pretty much team-based gameplay; mostly the same as regular Quake 3 Arena.

It's the classic tournament-style shooter, consisting of free-for-all matches to conquer and rise up the tiers, only to face one badass dude at the top tier and defeat him. That's not very descriptive, and I've only played two matches with bots after finally getting this myself, but I DO intend on playing the hell out of this. This was my game back when I was like, 10 or so. I think my dad liked these kinds of games the most. He would play this for so many hours in a week, and he'd let me play, too. I was a total boss somehow. I forget what difficulty I played on, but probably just medium.

Anyway, the goals are simple and you can't really get tired of this Quake game in particular. I really do recommend this ^-^

14958399.review:
Ok. Where do i start on this game? Although it appears that I have low play time on this game I actually played a hell of a lot of this game before I was on steam. This game is nuts, but you know..... fun nuts. The maps in this game are fun with not too many camping spots (as if you would feel the need to anyway) and are mostly quite large. 

Now....... The guns. Ok, so first up is the Machine Gun which is only good if you are accurate and your enemy is very inaccurate so lets skip this one. Then there is the Shotgun. One hit kill at short range of course and good damage at medium range. The Rocket Launcher is deadly to both your enemy and yourself but can also tend to take a few hits to kills if not hit directly. The Plasma Gun is basically a super Machine Gun. It has a lot more damage and similar fire rate. the Grenade Launcher in my opinion is the hardest gun to use because you have to time as well as place the grenade well. the Railgun, my favourite weapon, is basically a sniper that you have to no scope with (except unlike no scoper's in COD it actually takes skill) and is either a one or two hit kill. The Lightning Gun shoots out a stream of lightning towards your enemy and does decent damage. It's kind of like a Super Soaker except instead of water coming out there's lightning. And finally there is the BFG10K. now this gun is a one hit kill and has a fast automatic fire rate so it kicks arse. 

Now in addition to these guns is the gauntlet, which is basically a glove with a spinning saw blade on it. Its usually a two or three hit kill but its always fun to kill someone with it. also there are several other items that can be placed on the maps such as +5, +25 and +50 health capsules, +5 armour shards, +50 and +100 armour vests, a mega health capsule, a quad damage power-up, as well as a regeneration power-up and a beast power-up. I won't take the time to explain these items (Most of which are pretty self explanatory anyway). The best piece of advice that I can give you is to aim well. You aim well and you win....

Anyway I thoroughly reccomend this game to all and I hope this review helps.

13936808.review:
Coming back to this game after years and years of having forgotten all about it, is what I can best describe as a mix of nostalgia and satisfaction. Nostalgia because you recall the endless hours of a great game being played (mostly LAN's), and satisfaction because it actually still holds up against games of the current times, in terms of gameplay. If you're tired of either COD or BF, but still enjoy FPS'es, and you've not tried Quake III Arena, then you should do so. 

All the weapons in this game are pretty much available from the beginning, but this is not significant. What is however, is the fact that you really need to learn how to do things in this game. Motion and control has several levels that can be learned, e.g., rocket jumping, circle jumping, strafe jumping, etc. and these are all important for your survival. There's of course all the weapons too. Knowing how to fire a railgun is an important skill. If you meet superior opponents, and you lack these aforementioned skills, you will suffer, and quickly...

I really recommend this game if you want to try a classic that still has something to offer to those who wants some intense FPS action.

13714264.review:
Install OSP. The instructions suck, but all you need to do is take 4 of the files that start with "zz" and put them in q3base. Not the one with "server" in the name, that one will make it so single player games don't work. Now if you open console with ~ you can type "/ch_crosshaircolor 1" for example. I think names work too, like Red or Blue. Some servers don't like OSP. If you want to play on one that kicks you, take those files out. Keep the entire OSP folder in your main Q3 folder.

Other important settings: 
    \rate 25000
    \snaps 40
    \cl_maxpackets 125
    \com_maxfps 125
    \com_hunkMegs 128
    \cg_drawTeamOverlay 1
    \cg_noProjectileTrail 1

    \cg_enemyModel "keel/pm"
    \cg_enemyColors "iiii"
    \cg_trueLightning 1

Make sure your mouses polling rate is 500 or less or your gun will get stuck firing sometimes, or not fire at all occasionally.

If it keeps forcing your Game Key to Upper Case go into the games directory in Q3base and edit the key file with a text editor. Make it lowercase - save it - then right click the file and go to properties - make it read only. It may still ask for your key after a match but it's just a glitch, ignore it. As long as it doesn't do it BEFORE a match it makes no difference.

12480022.review:
Сразу хочу отметить, что:
1) Quake переводится как "дрожь, землетрясение".

2) Существует такая секта, последователи которой называют себя "квакерами". Так вот, эти люди не имеют ничего общего к играющим в кваку, которые тоже называют себя квакерами.

А теперь 10 тезисов о Quake III: Arena:

1) Это чистая многопользовательская игра. Присутствующий сингл-режим - это обычная беготня с тупоголовыми ботами.

2) Графика и все примочки потрясающие. Дизайн уровней - 5 с плюсом. Количество альтер эго, их проработка, оружие и прочее заставляют замуроваться в бетонную стену всех конкурентов.

3) Динамизм ака геймплей в лучших традициях Quake II. Unreal Tournament отдыхает.

4) Что бы вы ни думали, но в этой игре надо думать.

5) В игре присутствуют различные типы битв: от death match-a до capture the flag. Развлекайтесь.

6) Боты хоть и тупы, но на максимальном уровне сложности становятся поголовно снайперами.

7) Если вас убили - не бойтесь. Это вам не Counter-Strike, где надо по 2 минуты ждать возрождения.

8) Учитесь использовать рокет-джамп (rocket-jump) для достижения секретных кусков уровня.

9) Залог победы - знание уровня.

10) Вы еще читаете мою ахинею? Вперед, за победой, тов. Quake...

11568196.review:
After completing the campaign twice, and a few matches (I have a physical copy so those hours wont show) I can say that this is one of the best multiplayer based games I have ever played. Tight controls one expects from a PC fps are definetly put to use here, and if you wanted an example of PC over console, this is it. Story wise, this game is weeeaaak. It isnt told at all, and has unexplained cutscenes. You have to read the manual or look it up online to get what's going on, and I'm not going to tell you, as I feel it isnt to prominent in the game or this review. So that leaves the gameplay to decide how good of a game this is. the gameplay, is, amazing. As I said the controls are wonderful, and everything just works. Jumping to frag a guy and doing a 180 to frag another WHILE going dowhill onto another platform only to be propelled to a weapon of mass destruction is a great example of great gameplay, and fantastic level design. I would like to see how this game fairs on a console (Dreamcast version is all I know about unfortunately) but I cant imagine it being as good as the PC version. The soundtrack is a great metal and rock mix, full of the ambient sounds of screaming in some arenas gives off a darker mood, while the use of the metal can pump you up and ready you to blow up everyone in others. As far as characters go like I said the story is basically nill, but each has its own personality and little sayings in combat. Weapons in the game are designed well and all of them are fun to use, though it does seem a bit tedious stalking enemies with the machine gun you get right off the bat. Also, it is nice to see the BFG make an appearance.

My score: 8/10

Though the story is weak, I rated Half-Life a 8 or 9 and that had mediocre gameplay, so its alright. Also the game is just down right fun to play, and I will come back to it time and time again.

11555180.review:
[b]QIII[/b] is justly considered a [b]classic[/b], and is *still*, 15 years later, the [u]best shooter ever made[/u]. Its rules, its physics, its weapons are as simple as they are unrealistic. Yet, it is a perfectly oiled mechanism that you will go back to because it works [i]just right[/i].

Because its simple mechanics give you that sense of satisfaction to have played well (or at least, given your best) against worthy oponents, in a set of rules where only your [b]own skill[/b], not your hardware, achievements, level, buddies, equipment... made the difference.

Because it is [b]very immersive[/b], despite the unrealism of its setting and dated graphics: its physics, its actions, its pace are just defined by running, jumping and shooting, not encumbered with clunky, over-designed interactions in the name of "realism".

Because it [b]just works[/b]: no bugs, imbalances, lag, slowness, flakiness, choppiness, unresponsiveness, bloated interface, unintuitive design, complexity get in the way of playing.

You will simply come back to it because it is [b]The Game[/b], stripped of all the un-essential.

10817994.review:
Fucking. Hell. Yes. The Arena is a cruel, cruel Mistress - she will build you up, only to break you, & just when you think you're rid of her, she'll drag you back into her clutches.

In short, for those of you who are woefully unaware, Quake 3 is hands down the pinnacle of the "Old School" '90s FPSs designed by the original id Software team, using an entirely different Gameplay model than the Modern FPSs of CoD & BF. A more common term for it is "Twitch Gaming" due to the extreme level of reaction time required to truly match up against not only other players, but also the Bots. To quote Dark Souls - "Prepare to Die", because you will, over, & over, & over.

Seriously, buy it. Once you do, get ioQuake 3 (Google it), & the Quake 3 Widescreen Fixer Mod.

As far as the Online Multiplayer portion (which is arguably 95% of the Game) fear not, for the MP Community is still extremely active, & if you're of the ultra-competitive nature, the CPMA Mod (Challenge Pro Mode Arena - the Standard in Q3 Competitive Play since nearly the very beginning) ups the ante by making an already difficult Game even harder (works both Online (PvP) & Offline (Bots).

See you in the Arena, challenger.... If you dare ;D

P.S. You're also going to want to check out "Defrag" at some point or another, if for nothing else then to just learn more about THE most insane Mod of all time, hands down.

Fast paced arcade style action, and Quake 3 had some of the most finely tuned of this, with maps that were fast paced, as well as with their own pitfalls, camping spots, and high-risk items. My favorite part about this game was the customization, I have custom skins, models, weapon paks, maps, everything, and something about "shaders" makes me thrilled to see!  All and all, a fantastic game if you have a hankering for nostalgia of the time, and even if you dont, fast paced old school arcade action, with none of that regenerating health and realistic physics bogging down the gameplay. I miss these kinds of games!

This is one of the greatest first person shooter games out there; fast, frantic action, varying levels, and challenges. This is your classic arcade shooter action, with the simplest of instructions; kill anything that isn't you.

Even better, is that if you get bored of the stock content, there is a wealth of content created by the community. New maps, character models/skins, weapons, even total conversion mods that turn this into a completely new game.

Fantastic, brilliant multiplayer, and the Railgun. This is the only thing you need to know about this game. But regardless, here's some more info.

This game naturally inherited the smooth and fast-paced gameplay of its predecessor Quake (1996). As the original Quake was THE deathmatch classic in its time, Quake III Arena successfully rose to the throne and became the new king of its own time. Music is simple, yet it does the job very well. All the characters are very nicely voiced and the maps are, as expected from an id Software game, very very good. Oh and let's not forget the Railgun.

This game might be aging just like the original, but it is also timeless like the original. And just like the original, this is an important milestone in FPS genre, even if only for the multiplayer (that's what the game is about anyway!). By the way, did I mention the Railgun?

1369637.review:
This game will never die.  From 1999 to the present, this game has been at the heart of Esports throughout.  After Challenge Pro Mode Arena (CPMA) was released the competitive community divided.  Since then, the game's popularity has seen a steady decline.  Currently, there is only a small crowd of hardcore fans that still enjoy this game.  

Around 2007-2008 a new iteration of this game came along as a free-to-play web version named QuakeLive.  Download QLPrism (standalone browser made specifically to run QuakeLive) to fully enjoy.  As a pro-subscriber in Quakelive you can spawn servers to run all kinds of fun gameplay from simple duels to team based games and now Quakelive even includes Race mode (Quake3 DeFRaG Mod).  Quakelive is constantly updated with new content (gametypes, maps, custom options) making it the most comprehensive Quake ever.  

Quake 3 is one of the most enduring games in all of FPS history.  The gameplay is dynamic, engaging and unique.  If you are a fan of fast-paced, deathmatch style gameplay, Quake3/Quakelive is the ONLY game for you.  Takes years to master, takes seconds to become addicted.

Currently, there is some debate over whom the G.O.A.T. (Greatest Of All Time) of QuakeLive is.  The greatest contenders for the title include the two finalists of Dreamhack Winter 2013, the Belarussian "Cypher" or the American "Rapha."  Other names through the years include American "Zero4", the Swedish aim master "Toxjq", and the notorious Russian "Cooller".

In the end, I see the competition for this title always coming back to the two:  Cypher or Rapha!  After the latest Quakecon and Dreamhack tournaments in 2013 you can see why!!

3358122.review:
[h1]Monument du FPS multijoueur.[/h1]

Une des séries de jeux les plus modés avant l'arrivée de Minecraft et qui aura vu émerger un paquet d'autres FPS comme Team Fortress 2 ou Enemy Territory, des mods comme le CTF ou l'Instagib sans parler de la pléthore de jeux empruntant son moteur id Tech 3, succès que le id Tech 4 ne renouvellera pas.

L'unique reproche que je ferais à Quake 3 c'est l'absence d'une vraie communication sur les techniques de déplacements. Circle jumps, strafe, rocket jump... Un vrai mode solo prétexte à un long tutoriel aurait pu être fun !

Mes souvenirs de mes parties en lignes sont divisés en deux :
[list]• Ceux qui connaissaient et maîtrisaient les mouvements, et qui m'ont défoncé sans temps mort :D[/list]
[list]• Ceux qui ne connaissaient pas, à la ramasse, et t'accusent de tricherie parce que "tu voles"...[/list]

Je trouve que id Software aurait vraiment gagné à prendre en main les joueurs débutants en les incitant à apprendre ces techniques de déplacements qui, au final, font vraiment tout le sel des fast paced shooters.
Si l'on exclu Quake 4 et Warsow, on ne peut malheureusement pas dire que cette époque du FPS soient très prolifique de nos jours. Bon courage à Xonotic et Reflex !
Et ça ne semble pas être Quake Live qui changera la donne, vu que Bethesda Softworks ne semble pas decidé à réinjecter dans le développement même du jeu les maigres bénéfices tirés de ses abonnements premium et pro.

378929.review:
Quake III Arena (1998) is a memorable classic in my opinion. Consider this game if you enjoy classics and fast paced FPS gameplay. Even though I think Quake Live is a clone of this which makes it pointless to pay for this.

Quake 3 Arena combines FPS gameplay with extreme speed of reflection and extreme-pace gameplay. As with old games, the game does not have much variation and no customization in comparison to today's games, but can still be a great fun.

The gameplay consists of players; humanoid shaped hitboxes that move at a very fast speed without penalties, with a weapon selection including a rocket launcher, a railgun (one-hit precision killer), a shotgun and a few machine guns. The game modes at least include DM, TDM and CTF, not sure about others.

The gameplay is just about maneuvering and shooting very quickly and precisely. When you die, you respawn right away and the insanely fast fun continues.

1124177.review:
If you've never played this game (or quake 1/2), you cant really call yourself an FPS gamer. 

The epitome of twitch skills in a game. The raw skill level of players who still play this game is amazing, and probably the highest average skill level of any FPS community that currently exists. Not only is reaction speed and aim awarded, but equally important is fast and accurate movement (which is a skill in itself, and amazing to watch when you see some of the top level players).

Very high skill ceiling. Brutal for newbies. Rewarding to master. Makes you better at every other FPS. Probably has the highest Signal to Noise ratio of any futuristic FPS.

But if you want to try this now for the first time, play QuakeLive which is an updated version with a more active community.

To many, including myself, Quake is almost a religion.
It's not about hats, it's not about no-scoping, it's not about hurling verbal abuse at other players- It's about fun. And kicking Ass, fo course.

The game that defined multi-player lies before you. Picking up on the massive success of Quake 2's run-n-gun style, ID focuesed an entire game on turning your fellow man into pixelated cuts of meat.

Playing this game, even for a few moments, you can feel the raw creativity of ID. The level design, the balanced weapons, the interesting characters and the un-breakable engine make Quake III a simply un-missable game.

The single player revolves around you blasting bots into high heaven, and now a days, the multiplayer is only occupied by elite Quake-gods.

So i reconmend you go onto your internet browser and Download QUAKE LIVE: It's a free Quake 3. And you can play without getting your ass handed to you.

Brothers, Sisters, buy this game. Buy it now. Buy it and fall in love with Quake.

1029720.review: For the hardcore FPS player, this has got to be the game of choice. Still unmatched in speed and the pure adrenaline rush of competitive play, this classic game is just fun to play and I always find myself going back. This game is good for long gaming sessions, LAN play, or just for a quick match or two. It really has it all. Unreal Tournament has it beat in number of configuration options, but for core gameplay I will have to say Q3 wins out.

450773.review:
One of the best FPS gameplay: fast, fun, many free mods & maps, incredible high learning curve, frantic action. Pure speed, anticipation and precision here. Use the force for map control. ;-)
That’s a true PC FPS, not a console derivative handicapped targeted ersatz. No weapon or bonus to unlock, no llama health auto-regeneration, it’s just you, the keyboard, the mouse and the opponent(s).

Happy frags!!!

Oh... I almost forget: you won’t find any retarded turtle camper or sniper here. If you don’t move, you’re fragged. Period. :-D

PS: Only negative point (to be honest), it’s hard to find regular servers nowadays, too many excessive like servers imo. Highly recommended anyway.

2722795.review: This game is one of the best online games. It still has a very active community online and its very competative. Ive been playing this game since 99 and it is still thriving with the same players.This game never gets old. I love launching someone into the air with a rocket and then shooting them down with a rail. There are all types of game modes to all weapons, only rail and other mods that people come up. This is a very intense game, it might take some time to get used to the gameplay. The graphics to the game are great! You can customize things in the game to suit your style, for example you can choose a custom character or choose a default in game character, you can choose what your weapons look like and sound when you shoot them, there is just a bunch of things to change with the game. The single player part of the game just helps you practice and get ready when you actually face real people.This is a must have for any First Person Shooter lover. If you get it you wont regret it!
